page.title: 10Ecology - A Bird Survey.
page.content: In the field next to our school we set up a number of bird feeding areas and over about two weeks we surveyed the different types of birds that came to feed. In these feeding areas we put out the following types of food-nubble-mix,rabbit mix, biscuit crumbs,apple cores,crisps etc.We kept a count of the visiting birds.The most common of course were the sparrows but there were also quite a number of magpies and swallows. We spotted four swifts and two blackbirds. There were lso a number of seagulls & one thrush. We also went for a walk around our rea and looked for dead birds.Four had been hit by cars some were undamaged.We discovered that many of these birds were affected by pesticides a sprays put on the fields.In particular the finches seemed to be most affected.
